meanings.definition: Capable of being pursued or chased after.
meanings.sent1: The shiny object was easily pursuable by the curious cat.
meanings.sent2: The suspect left behind pursuable clues for the detective to follow.
meanings.sent3: The elusive butterfly seemed quite pursuable by the determined child.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were like colorful balloons, always just out of reach but pursuable.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map made the hidden chest seem more pursuable than ever before.

meanings.definition: Able to be followed or sought after.
meanings.sent1: The clear path was easily pursuable by the hikers.
meanings.sent2: The promising opportunity seemed very pursuable for the ambitious student.
meanings.sent3: The delicious aroma of freshly baked cookies was highly pursuable by the hungry guests.
meanings.sent4: His infectious laughter was a pursuable quality that drew others towards him.
meanings.sent5: The captivating story was so pursuable that everyone wanted to know what happened next.
